Question
========
A study on marriage age asks married men how old they were when they got married (for the first time). Scientist want to examine whether there are differences in average age at first marriage between men of different religious beliefs: Catholic, Protestant, Islam, or none. The SPSS output of the analysis is below.

![](uu-Oneway-ANOVA-850-nl-graph01.jpg)

What percentage of the total spread in ages at the first marriage of these men is explained by differences in religious beliefs?

Answerlist
----------
* 4.16%
* 4.59%
* 21.95%
* 95.41%


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Correct
* Not correct
* Not correct
